stimulusHtml: For the system consisting of only Block 1 , what forms of mechanical energy are present in the system and what reasoning supports the claim?

features.html: Two identical blocks 1 and 2 , are attached to each other by a spring and can slide with negligible friction along a straight, horizontal track. At one instant in time, the two blocks are moving with different velocities.

choicesHtml: Kinetic energy only because Block 1 is moving relative to Block 2.
Kinetic energy only because Block 1 is in motion but has no internal parts that can interact with each other.
Kinetic energy and elastic potential energy because both blocks are in motion and the spring length is changing.
Kinetic energy and elastic potential energy because Block 1 is in motion and the spring exerts an external force on it.
